text:
“Will you come tomorrow?” Sonia asked, her voice trembling.

Raskolnikov nodded. “You’re having a funeral lunch?”

“Yes, just a little,” she replied, looking down.

“Thank you for helping us yesterday,” she whispered.

He studied her face. It was thin, pale, and angular. 

Her blue eyes sparkled with kindness. 

“Can Katerina Ivanovna manage?” he pressed.

“It will be plain,” Sonia said, biting her lip. 

“We’ve planned it well. There will be enough.” 

Sonia controlled her trembling lips, glancing up at him. 

She looked so young, almost a child. 

Raskolnikov felt drawn to her simplicity.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia informs Raskolnikov about the funeral arrangements and expresses gratitude for his previous help, revealing her emotional struggle.
